content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 15 ยง 53.3 - Test procedure and records of test

State Regulations

The test procedure for determination of coefficient of
friction of brake linings and the change of coefficient of friction with
variables of temperature and time shall be the equivalent of the basic
procedure used in the brake lining manufacturing industry as described in

Recommended Practice SAE J661a of the Society of Automotive Engineers, as last
revised. Portions of that test procedure to be employed in tests under this
section include the following with the exceptions and additions given: (a) Description of test apparatus, except
that the heating curve characteristic of the friction machine used in the test, based on the change of drum temperature as a function of time when the drum is
running free is to be recorded. (b) Procedure, including preparation, conditionings, and measurements. (c) Test runs, including base line run, first
fade run, first recovery run, wear measurements and runs, second fade run, second recovery run and base line rerun. (d) Five complete tests, including
preparation and conditioning, are to be made for each brake lining submitted
for approval except as otherwise provided herein. (e) Recording of data on recommended master
form titled item 7.1 in SAE Recommended Practice SAE J661a, with the additions
that: (1)
friction readings should be recorded
at the temperature points that are necessary for the calculation of the normal
and hot coefficient of friction. Extrapolation between readings taken at times
specified in item 7.1 will be allowed to determine values required by
subdivisions (b) and (c) of section
53.4; (2)
the name of the operator is to be printed
completely and legibly in the space provided and is also to be
signed; (3)
the name of the company
or firm offering the brake lining for approval, the catalog or formulation
designation, and letter code of the purported coefficient of friction classes
of the brake lining are to be recorded on the line titled "Material". (f) Presentation of data on
recommended master form--plot sheet--item 7.2 in SAE Recommended Practice SAE
J661a, with the additions that: (1)
one plot
sheet is to be submitted showing the results of all five tests on one
sheet; (2)
plot sheets are to carry
legible printed name and signature of the person making the plot, name of the
company offering the brake lining for approval, the catalog or formulation
designation and letter code of purported coefficient of friction
class. (g) Computation
sheets for class coefficient of friction. A computation sheet shall be prepared
indicating the values of coefficient of friction which were found at the points
prescribed for normal friction and hot friction. The sheet shall also show the
prescribed averages of the values for purposes of identifying the classes. This
computation sheet shall be a part of the submittal data for approval of brake
linings. (h) Data from each
coefficient of friction run shall be recorded to three decimal places. The
calculated average shall be rounded off to two decimal places. Notes
